content.description: Start left of a small dihedral and climb past 4 bolts to a no-hands rest at a break in the cliff. Clip the 5th bolt and pull the roof using crimps, pockets, and a decent right foot hidden in some manky looking rock. Â Clip the 6th bolt after pulling onto the roof and keep it together on decent edges and pockets to the chains.
content.location: Take the trail up to Rival wall and when you reach the cliff line head right and walk about 50 feet.

content.description: Climb the face of a large flake though some pockets and crimps trying to avoid the manky holds near the crack. Gain a dirty ledge and pull the roof and climb straight up. After an okay rest on a decent pocket and sloper, trend left and up to the chains.
content.location: This route is left of Ultimate Rival and starts on a flake right of a large tree,
There are only two bolted lines around the far right corner at Rival Wall. The 10a, Monobrow, is the only other bolted route, and is to the right on the arete.

climbs.name: Monobrow
climbs.fa: Brad Combs, Don McGlone, JATD crew

content.description: Fun route, good variety of moves, interesting arete climb.
content.location: Bolted line on arete about 20 yards to the right of trailhead around the corner

content.description: Start in the awkward layback to good holds. Follow the good holds to a dirty ledge. Pull the weird roof thing anyway you can and then follow much easier moves up the vertical face to the top.
content.location: This is the route farthest to the right on the cliff face at the top of the approach trail to Rival Wall.

content.description: A very low quality route. Start by climbing the flake laying back up good jugs. Traverse left to a vertical crack splitting the face pull a couple awkward moves up into the large pod. Pull up into another pod and then clip the anchors shared with Days of Thunder
content.location: Farthest route to the right. Just to the right of Days of Thunder.

content.description:
This route has cleaned up very nicely leaving some beautiful pockets and edges up a slightly overhanging technical face.  Definitely an area classic.

Begin up the easy slab for a few bolts.  Start up the steepening face.  Make moves between thin edges, pockets, and an occasional jug.  Fight the pump the entire way to the anchors.  This climb has a lot less shake outs than its neighbor so keep moving.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a two bolt anchor.  Rappel with a 60m rope.
content.location: About 40' left of the approach trail and just to the left of Delayed Gratification.

climbs.name: Delayed Gratification
climbs.fa: Bram Bell, Bill Strachan, JATD crew, 2006

content.description:
This face climbs like something out of the gym.

Start at a right facing flake.  Make a couple of technical moves to get above onto the big iron horizontals.  Make a long move to gain a thin horizontal (crux) near the beginning of the face section.  Then follow huge iron ledges to a short section of pockets to the top fighting the pump the whole way.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a two bolt anchor.  Rap with a 60m rope.
content.location: Just left of an obtuse arete.  Just left of the approach trail.  Locate the two bolted faces that are slightly overhanging.

content.description: Warm up on good pockets and pinches for the first couple clips.  Arrive at a massive slot that may not let go of your hand (this slot will be a pond after a decent rain).  Pick your poison to move through the crux and push your way to a rest before the last bolt to the chains.  Last moves to chains are thinkers for sure.
content.location: Begin just right of a large hueco.  This is the first bolted route on the right side of the wall.  Just to the left is another 12a called Cork Eye.

climbs.name: Days of Thunder
climbs.fa: Mark Ryan, Jenny Ryan, Jarod Hancock, Karla Hancock 2006

content.description: Sorta fun if the other routes are occupied.  A little dirty with an interesting stem move or supposedly crux sloper sequence higher up
content.location: Furthest route climber's right at Rival Wall, past Monobrow about 80 yards.

content.description: Chimney up the dihedral. Top out or lower from the anchors on Monobrow.
content.protection: If you're short on Big Bros, fiddle in a small cam or nut at about 1/3rd height then run it to the top.
content.location: This is the wide, left facing dihedral just right of Monobrow.
